alert.note: Alert for Greene; Pickens; Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 28 at 7:11AM CST until January 29 at 1:12PM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Alabama... Tombigbee River At Bevill Lock and Dam affecting Pickens, Sumter and Greene Counties. .Flooding continues on the Tombigbee River and a flood warning remains in effect. The next statement will be issued this evening, or sooner if conditions warrant. && ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tombigbee River at Bevill Lock and Dam. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 122.0 feet, Cattle in low-lying areas of Southern Pickens County should be moved to higher ground. Cattle are cutoff in lowlands of Southern Pickens County at stages above 122 feet. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 AM CST Sunday the stage was 122.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:00 AM CST Sunday was 122.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 122.5 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 122.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
